content.description: Can be wet in spring. Work up a few feet of mossy, rotten stuff to a good right hand. Continue up the bulge, trending right and staying left of the arete. Thin, tough moves bring you below a roof, reach high left over the lip to a finger slot, heel hook right, and grunt over the top. Tough moves, but clean falls.
content.location: 30 feet left of Pizzle,  and to the right of the steep aid seems that start off big detached blocks.

content.description: Left variation of Split Shaft. After the third bolt step left and use a finger crack to get a high stance with some side pulls and crimps. Dyno (or stretch that ape index)  up to a big positive edge. Clip, move a bit right, then exit the roof on it‘s left side. Easy climbing after that to the shared anchor..
Nice warm up, easy moves with a thin, small roof. Anchors are up and left of a left facing dihedral, hard to see from ground. Old ring piton next to first bolt.
content.location: Just left past a low angled arete, about 30 feet to the left of the long and low roof area.

content.description: South facing, shaded by trees, and with some of the steepest rock at the hollow.
